div1.p: This article [translated by Strode?] describes the ceremony at the Oswaldo Cruz Institute in Brazil to honor Noguchi.

div1.head: Translation of an article from “A NOITE,” January 21, 1924. Rio de Janeiro
div1.p: Translation of an article from “A NOITE”, January 21, 1924. Rio de Janeiro.

Bahia. January 20. Professor Augusto Vianna, of the Faculdade de
Medicina, resolved to give to the laboratory of the Oswaldo Cruz Institute,
where the notable Japanese Bacteriologist, Doctor Hideyo Noguchi, is working,
the name “LABORATORIO DOCTOR NOGUCHI” and to place on its walls a commemorative
tablet.

There were present at the ceremony Doctor Noguchi, Doctor Muller and
his assistants and various physicians of Bahia.

Professor Augusto Vianna delivered a brief address explaining the
motive which caused them to render this homage to that scientist. Doctor Noguchi
was greatly moved, and, expressing his thanks, said he would try to answer the
many distinctions which he had received by working for the good of scientific ad-
vancement in this country. He thanked especially the illustrious Professor
Augusto Vianna, the creator of the Oswaldo Cruz Institute in Bahia, as well as
the soul of all the homage he had received there.
